In baseball, batting average (AVG) is a measure of a batter's success rate in 
achieving a hit during an at bat. In Major League Baseball (MLB), it is calculated 
by dividing a player's hits by his at bats (AB). In MLB, a player in each league 
wins the "batting title" each season for having the highest batting average that 
year. ...... average, one of just 13 seasons of a .400+ average in the 20th century.
